Package org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers

Class DirectoryHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers.DirectoryHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADAMHelper
    public class DirectoryHelper
extends Object
    Provides a generic implementation of directory specific settings, that for non-generic directories (like AD), could override when needed.

    • Method Detail

      • encodePassword

        public byte[] encodePassword​(IdType type,
                             byte[][] binaryValues)
        Encodes the password to use the "correct" character encoding for AD.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the identity, which should be always USER.
        binaryValues - The password value in binary format which is assumed to be correctly encoded already. May be null.
        Returns:
        The encoded password, or null if the input was null.

      • encodePassword

        public byte[] encodePassword​(IdType type,
                             Set<String> passwordValues)
        Encodes the password to use the "correct" character encoding for AD.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the identity, which should be always USER.
        passwordValues - The password value in string format to be encoded. May be null.
        Returns:
        The encoded password, or null if the input was null.

      • encodePassword

        public byte[] encodePassword​(String password)
        Encodes the password to use the "correct" character encoding.
        Parameters:
        password - The password in string format. May be null.
        Returns:
        The encoded password, or null if the input was null.

      • convertToInetUserStatus

        public String convertToInetUserStatus​(String value,
                                      String activeValue)
        Converts the directory specific status value to the default Inactive/Active values.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the user's status attribute.
        activeValue - The active value configured in the data store settings.
        Returns:
        Active if the value is null or the value is the same as activeValue. Otherwise returns Inactive.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​(String value,
                        String activeValue)
        Tells whether the user's status attribute corresponds to active or inactive status.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the user's status attribute.
        activeValue - The active value configured in the data store settings.
        Returns:
        true if the value is null or the value is the same as activeValue. Otherwise returns false.

      • getStatus

        public String getStatus​(DJLDAPv3Repo idRepo,
                        String name,
                        boolean isActive,
                        String userStatusAttr,
                        String activeValue,
                        String inactiveValue)
                 throws IdRepoException
        Returns the directory specific user status attribute value based on the default Inactive/Active settings.
        Parameters:
        idRepo - Reference to the IdRepo implementation, so extra attribute queries can be made.
        name - The name of the identity.
        isActive - The user status that needs to be represented.
        userStatusAttr - The name of the user status attribute.
        activeValue - The active value of the user status attribute.
        inactiveValue - The inactive value of the user status attribute.
        Returns:
        The directory specific user status attribute value.
        Throws:
        IdRepoException - If there was an error while retrieving the existing user status attribute.
